trans-unit.source: Paints an area with cached content.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class to reuse a cached element efficiently.
This is useful when you need to paint complex content onto multiple elements.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache> class to cache a complex element.

Assign a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target%2A> property and optionally assign a <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache> to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.BitmapCache%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.CacheMode> of the brush and the target <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> interact to produce different behaviors.
The following table describes this interaction.
Target has no CacheMode
Target has CacheMode
Brush has no CacheMode
Target visual renders normally; brush uses default cache behavior.
Target visual renders into its own cache; brush uses targetâ€™s cache when rendering.
Brush has CacheMode
Target visual renders normally; brush renders target into its own cache and uses this to render.
Target visual renders into its own cache; brush renders target into brush's own cache and uses this to render.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush> class, but <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> always renders from a cache on the target element, or from a cache defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.BitmapCache%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class also supports dirty regions.
The following table shows the default bitmap cache settings for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class.
Bitmap Cache Property
Default Setting
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache.SnapsToDevicePixels%2A> property is ignored by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class ignores the following properties on the root <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>.
This behavior differs from the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to cache and use as the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether layout is applied to the contents of this brush.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.AutoLayoutContent%2A> property is `true`, layout is applied to the contents of the brush if <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target%2A> is a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> with no parent.
`true` if layout is applied; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.AutoLayoutContent"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CacheMode"></xref> that represents cached content.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.BitmapCache%2A> property interacts with the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target%2A> property.
For a table that shows this interaction, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class overview.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache"></xref> that represents cached content.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.BitmapCache"></xref> dependency property.
Creates a modifiable clone of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush"></xref>, making deep copies of the object's values.
When copying the object's dependency properties, this method copies expressions (which might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone (deep copy) of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush"></xref> using its current values.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `true.`
Gets or sets the target visual to cache.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target%2A> property interacts with the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.BitmapCache%2A> property.
For a table that shows this interaction, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush> class overview.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to cache and paint with.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.BitmapCacheBrush.Target"></xref> dependency property.
